description: Learned borrowing from Latin praemeditātus, past particuple of praemeditor (“I premeditate”). By surface analysis, pre- +‎ meditate.

verbs.description: premeditate (third-person singular simple present premeditates, present participle premeditating, simple past and past participle premeditated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To meditate, consider, or plan beforehand; to think about and revolve in the mind beforehand.
